thread.title: Picks of the Week
thread.title_full: Picks of the Week | Business Spectator

author: Cliona O'Dowd
title: Picks of the Week
text:
Turnbull's cabinet must not yield to rogue lobbyists
Robert Gottliebsen
Bruce Billson's experience with disgraceful corporate lobbying is a valuable lesson for Malcolm Turnbull and his ministers.
Morrison's honesty on tax will boost confidence
Adam Carr
Treasurer Scott Morrison's comments hint at an approach to tax reform that would enhance growth instead of curbing it.
A missed opportunity for SMSFs
Miranda Maxwell
An extreme home bias has paid off for SMSFs over the past decade, but economic changes may finally force a larger chunk of this $590bn pool into offshore equities.
The Fed has met the criteria for a rate rise
Victoria Thieberger
Despite financial market ructions, the slowdown in China does not represent a big risk to US growth.
Volkswagen scandal reveals culture of regulation without enforcement
Tristan Edis
The story behind the discovery of Volkswagen’s cheating of emission standards illustrates a far broader problem extending to other car makers and even extends beyond cars to fridges and home construction.
The shaky foundations of Europe's asylum-seeker deal
Amber Plum
Even in its diluted form the asylum-seeker resettlement plan is igniting tensions between western and eastern states. But much more needs to be done.
Don't believe the market fearmongers
Michael McCarthy
Despite all the gloomy sharemarket predictions, there are opportunities for investors with patience and nerves of steel.
Will Xi’s visit mark a turning point for US-China relations?
Peter Cai
Against the tense background of the many disputes that have developed between Beijing and Washington, Xi Jinping's visit could see a breakthrough in the Sino-US relationship.
Most read
Pyne is a key cog in Turnbull's 21st century cabinet
Supratim Adhikari
He may have prefered defence but Christopher Pyne now faces the task of turning Turnbull's innovation rhetoric into action.
Most commented
Our broken tax system needs more than a band-aid solution
Callam Pickering
The flaws in our tax system will not be fixed through piecemeal changes. We need a sweeping revolution that strips it back to its core elements.
